heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 08 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 10.6°C), outside temperature (down 9.2°C), and inside temperature (down 3.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 7489 lux) and cloud levels (up 475 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 7933 lux), dew point temperature (up 9.3°C), outside temperature (up 10.5°C), and cloud levels (up 453 m) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 474.8m lower than yesterday, 333.2m lower than the past week, 453.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 993m and a peak of 2630m, averaging 1147.8m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; subzero temperatures are forecasted. Also, dry and less humid conditions and winds will be practically absent. A few light raindrops may fall, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and the light is absent. Stable weather patterns due to high pressure.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (2.7°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
